chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency by Defendant.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:45 AM Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
SPD has not yet appointed counsel for defendant.
Defendant submits petition for appointment of counsel for the Court's review.
BTC: Court appoints counsel for defendant on all three cases.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:43 AM Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
SPD has not yet appointed counsel for defendant.  Defendant unable to financially afford to retain private counsel at this time.
BTC: Set for status in 2 weeks.  Defendant to fill out petition for court appointed counsel and bring to next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander J. Kostal in court for David Z Williams Jr as a friend of the court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
NG plea entered. 
BTC: SPD to continue searching for counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.
Arraignment on August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have counsel, defendant wishes to proceed with todays hearings without counsel.
Court performs colloquy with defendant to proceed pro se.
State puts the maximum penalties and elements on the record for 22CF399, 22CF400, and 22CF401.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant on understanding of maximum possible penalties.
Defendant understands the possible penalties and wishes to proceed pro se for the preliminary hearings.
Court begins with 22CF401
Court gives defendant copy of criminal complaint for 22CF401
State calls Officer Nuttall. DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defendant on cross.
Parties rest. 
State moves for bind over.
Defendant makes statement.
BTC: probable cause, bound over on all charge in 22CF401.
Court proceeds with 22CF399.
Court gives defendant copy of criminal complaint in 22CF399
State calls Investigator Wilcox DSAT.
Direct by the State.
Defendant on cross.
States witness excused.
Defendant calls witness Valerie Turney, DSAT
Court performs colloquy with witness.
Direct by Defendant.
State has no questions.
State moves for bind over.
BTC: Probable cause, bound over on all charges in 22CF399
Court continues with case 22CF400
Court gives defendant copy of criminal complaint in 22CF400
State calls Investigator Wilcox, DSAT
Direct by the State
Defendant has no questions for witness.
States witness is excused.
Defendant calls Witness Valerie Turner- DSAT
Direct by the Defendant.
State has no questions.
Witness excused.
State moves for bind over.
Defendant makes statement.
BTC: Probable cause found, bound over on all charges in 22CF400.
Arraignment set
Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. Defendant wishes to proceed to preliminiary hearing without counsel. 
BTC: Defendant can proceed. Preliminary hearing to be set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.
Status conference on June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant is still working on retaining counsel.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits to allow defendant time to be appointed or retain counsel.
Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
SPD has not appointed counsel as of this date.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant is eligible for SPD, but has not been appointed counsel at this time.
BTC: Continue waiving time limits to give SPD and Family more time to appoint/ retain counsel. If no counsel at this time, County to also try and appoint.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from SPD, no appointment of counsel as of this date.
Status conference on May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Z Williams Jr in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have counsel at this time. Indicates his family is working on retaining counsel. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits for holding a preliminary hearing based upon defendants statements of trying to retain private counsel, or be appointed by SPD
Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointed as of this date.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce DNA Evidence, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records Without Extrinsic Evidence by the State.
of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with any minors. No contact with the victim T.J.S (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Z Williams Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston appeared by video for David Z Williams Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
